Package asteroids.game

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • asteroids.game.Controller
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.lang.Iterable<Participant>, java.util.EventListener
    public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.lang.Iterable<Participant>
    Controls a game of Asteroids.

    • Field Detail

      • pstate

        private ParticipantState pstate
        The state of all the Participants

      • ship

        private Ship ship
        The ship (if one is active) or null (otherwise)

      • refreshTimer

        private javax.swing.Timer refreshTimer
        When this timer goes off, it is time to refresh the animation

      • transitionTime

        private long transitionTime
        The time at which a transition to a new stage of the game should be made. A transition is scheduled a few seconds in the future to give the user time to see what has happened before doing something like going to a new level or resetting the current level.

      • lives

        private int lives
        Number of lives left

        private int score
        Indicates the players current score

        Indicates the current level

        The game display

    • Method Detail

      • iterator

        public java.util.Iterator<Participant> iterator()
        This makes it possible to use an enhanced for loop to iterate through the Participants being managed by a Controller.
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface java.lang.Iterable<Participant>

      • getShip

        public Ship getShip()
        Returns the ship, or null if there isn't one

      • splashScreen

        private void splashScreen()
        Configures the game screen to display the splash screen

      • finalScreen

        private void finalScreen()
        The game is over. Displays a message to that effect.

      • placeShip

        private void placeShip()
        Place a new ship in the center of the screen. Remove any existing ship first.

      • placeAsteroids

        private void placeAsteroids()
        Places an asteroid near one corner of the screen. Gives it a random velocity and rotation.

      • clear

        private void clear()
        Clears the screen so that nothing is displayed

      • initialScreen

        private void initialScreen()
        Sets things up and begins a new game.
